meanings.definition: Carry out or put into effect (a plan, order, or course of action)
meanings.sent1: I will execute the plan as soon as possible.
meanings.sent2: The team will execute the new strategy in the next meeting.
meanings.sent3: Trying to execute a surprise party for my friend was challenging.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's ability to execute a lesson plan is impressive.
meanings.sent5: She executed the dance moves flawlessly.

meanings.definition: Put (a person) to death as a legal punishment
meanings.sent1: The court decided to execute the criminal for his crimes.
meanings.sent2: In some countries, they still execute people for certain offenses.
meanings.sent3: The movie villain's plan was to execute the hero, but he failed.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to execute the trees, leaving a path of destruction.
meanings.sent5: The king ordered to execute the traitor at dawn.

meanings.definition: Perform or carry out (a task or action)
meanings.sent1: I need to execute this project before the deadline.
meanings.sent2: The chef will execute the recipe with precision.
meanings.sent3: The robot was programmed to execute various commands.
meanings.sent4: The athlete must execute the jump perfectly to win.
meanings.sent5: The musician will execute the song flawlessly on stage.
